title: Personal Introduction
summary: I'm Mohamed, a software engineer who loves building scalable applications using Spring Boot and Angular. I focus on clean architecture, performance, and real-world usability.
content:
I'm Mohamed, a software engineer who genuinely loves coding and building real-world projects. I'm always looking for opportunities to work on big, challenging projects where I can learn, grow, and actually make an impact. I care about the little details in my code—sometimes that even means initializing age as a short instead of an int just to optimize performance. Writing efficient, clean, and maintainable code is something I take seriously.
I have experience with multiple programming languages, including C++, Java, and Python, and I've built several projects using Spring Boot and Angular. I'm comfortable working with databases like MongoDB, PostgreSQL, SQL, Cassandra, Redis, and even newer tools like ChromaDB. I've also explored some machine learning concepts like vector embeddings and RAG, using them to make applications smarter and more dynamic.
On the DevOps side, I know my way around CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, and SonarQube, and I'm familiar with testing frameworks like JUnit and Mockito. I've also worked with Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, and cloud platforms like Azure, which makes me confident in deploying and managing applications end-to-end.
I'm the kind of person who loves figuring things out, learning new technologies, and making code better wherever I can. I focus on performance, scalability, and real-world usability, and I'm always looking for ways to improve both myself and the projects I work on.
In short, I'm a hands-on, performance-focused engineer who's excited about building meaningful software and being part of a team that tackles real-life challenges.

title: Technical Support Specialist – The Hive (UPDATED)
summary: I work with luxury brands, supporting worldwide applications with complex architectures. I've reduced ticket resolution costs and created internal documentation to improve team efficiency.
content: As an L2 Technical Support Specialist at The Hive, I support multiple applications used by luxury brands worldwide. These systems have giant, complex architectures with multiple data sources and distributed microservices. I manage and resolve user-reported tickets, investigate production incidents using Postman, Elasticsearch (Kibana), Kafka, and JIRA, and perform root cause analysis. I coordinate with development and infrastructure teams to escalate and resolve problems efficiently. One of my key achievements was reducing the budget of our ticket pipeline by streamlining workflows and creating internal troubleshooting documentation. Since ServiceNow ticket resolution time is expensive, the company was very happy with this cost reduction. I've also improved our debugging processes through automation scripts, making the team more efficient overall.
responsibilities: Supporting luxury brand applications used globally
Managing L2 technical support tickets across complex architectures
Investigating production incidents using Postman, Kibana, and Kafka
Performing root cause analysis and coordinating with dev teams
Creating internal documentation and knowledge base
achievements: Reduced ticket resolution budget, saving significant ServiceNow costs
Improved debugging process through automation scripts

title: IT Developer – Mondiale des Etudes & Réalisations Industrielles
summary: Started as IT Support, then evolved into developing document management and workflow automation solutions using Power Platform and Python.
content: Started as IT Support at Mondiale des Etudes & Réalisations Industrielles, then evolved into developing document management and workflow automation solutions. Built custom workflows using Power Automate and Power Apps to streamline business processes. Developed Python scripts for Alfresco document management system integration. Created automated reporting systems and improved document tracking efficiency across departments.
responsibilities: Developing workflow automation using Power Automate and Power Apps
Building Python scripts for Alfresco integration

title: Full-Stack Developer – New Technologies (PFE)
summary: Developed a full C2C e-commerce marketplace using Angular and Spring Boot as part of my final-year project.
content: Developed a full C2C marketplace web application with Angular frontend and Spring Boot backend as my final-year project (PFE). Implemented user subscription, messaging, buying/selling, and boutique account features. Ensured security using Spring Security and JWT for API protection. Integrated email verification, multi-role access control, and personalized product recommendations on the homepage. Built a complete e-commerce platform supporting customer-to-customer transactions.

title: Intern – Bank of Tunis
summary: My first professional experience where I learned time management and teamwork by assisting daily operations and client interactions at Bank of Tunis.
content: My first professional experience as an intern at Bank of Tunis. I assisted with daily agency operations, managed client interactions, prepared reports, and worked with Excel for data entry and basic analysis. I improved my time management, organization, and communication skills in a professional environment. Successfully managed client requests and documentation for over 50 accounts. This experience taught me professional communication and understanding of structured workflows in the banking sector.
achievements: Successfully managed client requests and documentation for over 50 accounts

title: CareForElders – AI-Powered Elderly Care Platform
summary: Built an AI-assisted elderly care management platform using Spring Cloud microservices and ChromaDB to provide smart, contextual responses from medical case data.
content: Built an AI-assisted elderly care management platform using Spring Cloud microservices architecture and ChromaDB for intelligent data retrieval. The system provides smart, contextual responses from medical case data using RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) technology. Implemented microservices for patient management, caregiver scheduling, medication tracking, and AI-powered health monitoring. Used ChromaDB for semantic search of medical records and Angular for the frontend interface.

title: FullCare_App – Blockchain Healthcare Document Management
summary: Developed a decentralized healthcare system using Hedera Hashgraph where each medical record is securely tied to an NFT, allowing doctors to access records only with token authorization.
content: Developed a decentralized healthcare document management system using Hedera Hashgraph blockchain technology. Each medical record is securely tied to an NFT (Non-Fungible Token), allowing doctors to access records only with proper token authorization. Built with Angular frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL database. Implemented secure authentication, role-based access control, and blockchain-based medical record verification. This ensures patient data privacy while enabling authorized healthcare providers to access critical medical information.

title: MultiPurpose_Ecommerce – Customizable B2B/B2C Platform
summary: Developed a modular e-commerce platform supporting both B2B and B2C operations with dynamic storefronts, admin dashboards, and secure JWT authentication.
content: Developed a modular, multi-purpose e-commerce platform supporting both B2B (Business-to-Business) and B2C (Business-to-Consumer) operations. Features include dynamic storefronts, comprehensive admin dashboards, inventory management, order processing, and secure JWT authentication. Built with Angular for the frontend and Spring Boot for the backend, using MongoDB for flexible data storage. The platform supports multiple vendors, customizable product catalogs, and role-based access control for different user types.

title: Software Engineering – Private Higher School of Engineering and Technology
institution: Private Higher School of Engineering and Technology (ESPRIT)
summary: Studying Software Engineering at the Private Higher School of Engineering and Technology (Tunis) through night courses while working full-time.
content: Currently pursuing an Engineering Degree in Software Engineering at the Private Higher School of Engineering and Technology (ESPRIT) in Tunis through night courses while working full-time. I chose the night program to gain professional experience and fund my education simultaneously. This experience has shaped my resilience, discipline, and ability to apply theoretical knowledge directly to practice in real-world scenarios. The curriculum covers advanced software architecture, distributed systems, AI, and modern development practices.

title: Information Systems Development – Higher Institute of Technological Studies of Rades
institution: Higher Institute of Technological Studies of Rades (ISET Rades)
degree: Technician Degree in Information Systems Development
summary: Graduated in Information Systems Development at ISET Rades, focusing on software architecture and teamwork.
content: Graduated with a Technician Degree in Information Systems Development from the Higher Institute of Technological Studies of Rades (ISET Rades). The program focused on software architecture, database design, web development, and team-based project work. Completed my final year project (PFE) developing a full-stack C2C e-commerce marketplace using Spring Boot and Angular. This education provided a strong foundation in programming, system analysis, and software development methodologies.

title: Personal Information & Languages
summary: I'm 28 years old, based in Tunis, Tunisia. I speak English fluently, French at B2 level, and Arabic natively.
content: I'm Mohamed, 28 years old, based in Tunis, Tunisia. I speak three languages: English (fluent), French (B2 - Upper-Intermediate level), and Arabic (native speaker). My multilingual abilities allow me to work effectively in international and multicultural environments. I'm comfortable conducting technical discussions and writing documentation in all three languages.

title: Technical Skills Overview
summary: Comprehensive full-stack skill set spanning web development, backend systems, DevOps, databases, and AI technologies.
content: PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES: Java, Python, C++, JavaScript/TypeScript. FRONTEND: Angular, HTML5, CSS3, Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, React (basic). BACKEND: Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Node.js, Express.js, REST APIs, Microservices. DATABASES: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Cassandra, Redis, ChromaDB. DEVOPS & TOOLS: Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, SonarQube, Kafka, Git. TESTING: JUnit, Mockito, Integration Testing. CLOUD: Azure, Azure OpenAI. AI/ML: Vector Embeddings, RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation), ChromaDB, Semantic Search. OTHER: Elasticsearch, Kibana, JIRA, Postman, Power Automate, Power Apps, Alfresco.

title: Engineering Philosophy & Career Goals
summary: I believe technology should simplify lives. My goal is to build scalable, human-centric systems that make a real impact.
content: I believe technology should exist to simplify people's lives, not complicate them. My goal as an engineer is to build scalable, human-centric systems that make a real, measurable impact on users and businesses. I'm passionate about clean code, performance optimization, and creating solutions that actually solve problems rather than creating new ones. I value continuous learning, collaboration, and working on challenging projects where I can grow while contributing meaningfully. I want to be part of teams that tackle real-life challenges and build software that matters.

title: Problem Solving & Team Collaboration
summary: I handle challenges calmly, focusing on root-cause analysis, clear communication, and effective teamwork.
content: I approach problems methodically, focusing on root-cause analysis rather than quick fixes. When facing challenges, I remain calm and break down complex issues into manageable parts. I believe clear communication is as important as technical skills - I document my work thoroughly and explain technical concepts in ways that non-technical stakeholders can understand. I thrive in collaborative environments where knowledge sharing is encouraged. I'm comfortable asking for help when needed and equally comfortable helping others. I've learned that the best solutions often come from team discussions rather than working in isolation.

title: Current Daily Work & Context
summary: I currently work with luxury brands, supporting multiple worldwide applications with complex, giant architectures. I'm also maintaining a freelance e-commerce project I've been working on for 4 months.
content: Right now, I work as an L2 Technical Support Specialist at The Hive, where we support applications for luxury brands used globally. These systems have massive, complex architectures with multiple data sources, which means I'm constantly dealing with distributed systems, debugging production incidents across microservices, and tracing issues through Kafka streams and Elasticsearch logs. On the side, I've been maintaining a freelance project for the past 4 months—a fully customizable e-commerce platform where the admin can track, update, and change anything on the client's frontend. You can check my GitHub for reference. Balancing full-time work, freelance projects, and night school keeps me busy, but I love the challenge and the constant learning.

title: How I Approach Debugging
summary: I follow the data flow pipeline to debug issues, tracing from source to destination through each system layer.
content: When I debug an issue, I always follow the pipeline of the data flow. I start by identifying where the data enters the system, then trace it through each layer—API endpoints, service logic, database queries, message queues like Kafka, and finally the response. I use tools like Postman to reproduce the request, Kibana to check logs at each step, and Kafka UI to verify events are being published and consumed correctly. This systematic approach helps me pinpoint exactly where things break, whether it's a validation error, a missing event, a database timeout, or a misconfigured service. I've found that understanding the full journey of data through the system is the fastest way to identify root causes.

title: Why I Chose Software Engineering
summary: I've loved tech since I was a kid—it's the one thing I know I'm truly good at.
content: I chose software engineering because I've loved tech since I was a kid. Growing up, I was always the one fixing computers, figuring out how things worked, and getting excited about new technology. It's honestly the only thing I feel I'm truly good at—that natural pull toward understanding systems and building things. When I write code that solves a real problem or when I finally track down a tricky bug, that satisfaction is unmatched. For me, software engineering isn't just a career choice; it's what I'm meant to do.

title: My Biggest Technical Challenge
summary: Building the RAG pipeline for CareForElders and implementing blockchain-based access control for FullCare_App were my biggest technical challenges.
content: My biggest technical challenge was building the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipeline for the CareForElders project. Understanding how to transform text into meaningful vector embeddings, how the LLM interprets that vector space, and how to structure the retrieval logic to get relevant context was completely new territory for me. I had to learn about semantic search, ChromaDB, embedding models, and how to architect a system where the AI responses are grounded in actual data rather than hallucinations. Managing the Docker containers, scripting the data ingestion pipeline, and debugging why certain queries weren't retrieving the right documents took a lot of trial and error. Another major challenge was implementing the blockchain-based medical record access control in FullCare_App using Hedera Hashgraph. Working with NFTs, understanding the Hedera Token Service, and ensuring secure, decentralized access to sensitive medical data required me to think completely differently about authentication and authorization. Both projects pushed me far outside my comfort zone, but they taught me that I can learn anything if I break it down step by step.

title: What I'm Currently Learning
summary: I'm currently learning Azure cloud concepts. I've already deployed this portfolio chatbot on Azure and can monitor resources, but I want to dive deeper into cloud architecture.
content: Right now, I'm focused on learning Azure cloud concepts. I've already deployed this portfolio chatbot on Azure and I can monitor resources through the Azure portal, but I want to dive much deeper—understanding Azure Functions, App Services, Container Instances, and how to architect scalable, cost-effective cloud solutions. I'm also exploring Azure OpenAI Service integration, managed databases, and CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps. My goal is to become confident in designing and deploying full production-grade applications on Azure, not just hosting them. Cloud is the future, and I want to be strong in at least one major platform.

title: Balancing Work and Night School
summary: Balancing full-time work, freelance projects, and night school is tough—I have almost no social life—but it's a challenge I've successfully managed and I'm close to finishing.
content: Balancing full-time work at The Hive, freelance projects, and night school at ESPRIT is honestly difficult. I have almost no social life—most of my time goes into working during the day, attending classes at night, and squeezing in freelance work and studying on weekends. But I see it as a good challenge. I chose the night program specifically so I could gain professional experience and fund my education at the same time, and I'm proud that I've made it this far. I graduate in 2026, and knowing that I've managed to work, study, and keep learning new technologies simultaneously shows me that I can handle pressure and stay committed to my goals. It's taught me discipline, time management, and resilience—skills that are just as valuable as any technical knowledge.

title: Career Goals & Aspirations
summary: I want to be part of a huge, complex project that challenges me deeply—especially in backend performance, distributed systems, and large-scale architecture.
content: Honestly, I want to be part of a huge, complex project that really tests my limits. I'm talking about systems with multiple services, high traffic, performance bottlenecks to solve, and challenging architectural decisions to make. I want a role where I'm constantly learning, where I have to deep dive into backend performance optimization, distributed systems, caching strategies, database scaling, and microservices orchestration. I thrive in environments where the problems are hard and the stakes are high. I don't want to just maintain existing systems—I want to build, improve, and architect solutions that handle real-world scale. That's where I see myself growing the most, and that's the kind of work that excites me.

title: Core Strengths & Confidence Areas
summary: I'm confident in anything tech-related, but especially in Java and Spring Boot concepts—from dependency injection to microservices architecture.
content: I'm confident in anything related to technology, but I'm especially strong in Java and Spring Boot. I understand the core concepts deeply—dependency injection, Spring's IoC container, AOP, Spring Data JPA, Spring Security, building RESTful APIs, exception handling, validation, and testing with JUnit and Mockito. I've built multiple production-level applications with Spring Boot, and I'm comfortable working with Spring Cloud for microservices, including service discovery, API gateways, and distributed configuration. I can debug complex issues, optimize performance, and design clean, maintainable architectures. When it comes to backend development, I know what I'm doing, and I can pick up new frameworks or languages quickly because I understand the underlying principles.

title: Budget Reduction Achievement at The Hive
summary: I reduced the budget of our ticket pipeline at The Hive, which made the company very happy since ServiceNow ticket resolution time costs a lot.
content: One of my key achievements at The Hive was reducing the budget of our ticket resolution pipeline. The company was spending heavily on ServiceNow ticket resolution time, and I identified inefficiencies in our workflow. By streamlining the investigation process, creating internal documentation, and automating repetitive debugging steps, I was able to significantly cut down resolution time. This directly reduced costs, and the company was very happy with the results. It taught me that even in a support role, there's always room to improve processes and add value beyond just resolving tickets.

title: Soft Skills & Professional Qualities
summary: Strong communication, teamwork, problem-solving, adaptability, time management, and a proactive learning mindset.
content: Beyond technical skills, I bring strong soft skills to any team. I communicate clearly and effectively, whether I'm explaining a technical issue to a non-technical stakeholder, writing documentation, or collaborating with developers and infrastructure teams. I work well in teams and understand that the best solutions come from collaboration, not working in silos. I'm a strong problem-solver—I stay calm under pressure, break down complex issues, and find root causes systematically. I'm highly adaptable and can learn new tools or technologies quickly. My time management skills are solid—I've proven that by balancing work, freelance projects, and night school successfully. Most importantly, I'm proactive. I don't wait for someone to tell me what to learn or how to improve—I take initiative and push myself to grow.

title: Why Looking for New Opportunities
summary: I'm looking for a new challenge. I'll soon graduate as a software engineer and want to transition fully into development, diving deeper into building complex systems.
content: I'm looking for new opportunities because I'm seeking a new challenge. I'll graduate as a software engineer in 2026, and I want to transition fully into a development role where I can dive deep into building complex systems, not just supporting them. My current role has taught me a lot about production systems, debugging, and how real-world applications work at scale, but I'm ready to be on the other side—designing, architecting, and writing the code that powers those systems. I want to grow as a backend engineer, work on challenging projects, and be part of a team that's building something meaningful and technically demanding.

title: Salary Expectations
summary: Based on my experience and skills, I think 1500 dinars would be a fair starting point, but I'm open to discussion based on the role and growth opportunities.
content: Based on my experience, skills, and the value I bring, I think 1500 dinars would be a fair starting salary. However, I'm flexible and open to discussion depending on the role, the company, and the growth opportunities available. What's most important to me is joining a team where I can learn, contribute meaningfully, and grow as an engineer. If the project is challenging and the learning environment is strong, I'm willing to be reasonable about compensation.

title: Relocation Willingness
summary: Yes, I'm open to relocation if the opportunity is right.
content: Yes, I'm absolutely open to relocation. If the right opportunity comes along—one that offers strong growth, challenging projects, and a great team—I'm willing to move. I'm not tied to one location, and I see relocation as a chance to experience new environments and expand my professional network.

title: Contact Information & Links
summary: You can find me on LinkedIn and GitHub for more details about my projects and professional background.
content: You can connect with me on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/mechergui-mohamed-salah/ to see my full professional background, recommendations, and network. My GitHub is https://github.com/mohamed1312131, where you can explore my projects, including the freelance e-commerce platform I'm currently maintaining, the CareForElders RAG system, and other full-stack applications I've built. Feel free to reach out through either platform—I'm always open to discussing opportunities, collaborations, or technical topics.

title: Custom E-Commerce Platform (Freelance - Ongoing)
summary: Currently maintaining a fully customizable e-commerce platform for a client (4 months ongoing). Admin can track, update, and change anything on the frontend dynamically.
content: I've been working on a freelance e-commerce project for the past 4 months, building a fully customizable platform where the admin has complete control. The admin can track orders, update product catalogs, change frontend layouts, modify pricing, and adjust the client's store appearance—all dynamically without touching code. Built with Angular for the frontend and Spring Boot for the backend, the system includes inventory management, order processing, user authentication, and a comprehensive admin dashboard. I'm currently maintaining and iterating on this project based on client feedback, adding new features and improving performance. You can check my GitHub for more technical details and code samples.
